intro: Burckella hollrungii, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits that resemble small bells. The plant has small, compound leaves and produces clusters of fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers. It is adapted to survive in dry environments with deep root systems and the ability to fix nitrogen through symbiotic bacteria. Burckella hollrungii plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
